name: CoRoTID 223977153
scenarioDescription:
The CoRoTID 223977153 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoTID 223977153 is a star with 1.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.79 times its radius. It is located 1911.926472 light years away from the solar system.

CoRoTID 223977153 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoTID 223977153 system

CoRoTID 223977153 b

CoRoTID 223977153 b was discovered by the CoRoT observatory using the Transit method. The mass of CoRoTID 223977153 b is 47.6745 times the mass of Earth. The radius of CoRoTID 223977153 b is 6.389 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, CoRoTID 223977153 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoTID 223977153, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by CoRoT.
